lines.text: [Takeda speaks in Japanese with a chuckle]
Takeda is impressed Mr. Racine. No one has ever escaped the Makato, now you've done it twice.
Tell 'im it's not a skill I wish to continue practicing.
I'm not going because you won't let me go. I'm your prisoner, right?
You are free to go, see how long you live without me to protect you!
That's exactly what I'm going to do. I'm taking the first flight back to New York, then I'm going to send Kinjo a postcard, see how well he does in my turf
Nothing can stop them from finding and killing you.
So how did they screw up and leave me alive?
Even monkeys fall out of trees.
Time does not die; only people.
[Paul Racine, still injured, is carrying two buckets of coal]

[puffing]
I wish I knew Japanese so I could tell this guy, I am not a donkey.
How much blood do I have to bath in, to get clean?

[last words]
I'll be waiting for you in hell.
